radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is abnormally dilated with a proximal diameter of 14 mm and tapers to 10 mm. There is extensive wall enhancement and surrounding fluid and phlegmonous change. A small periappendiceal fluid collection measuring approximately 2.1 x 2.8 x 2.4 cm is noted. Multiple small reactive lymph nodes are seen in the RLQ. A small amount of free fluid is seen in the pelvis. Additional findings include a 15 x 14 mm left adrenal nodule and normal liver, pancreas, spleen, kidneys, and gallbladder.
